summary: Defines a transformation pass that tracks successive DAG circuit states during transpilation to detect when a relative semi‑stable or local minimum has been reached. It records relevant property‑set values, keeps a deep copy of the best DAG observed, and after a configurable backtrack depth either signals that a fixed point is achieved or restores the stored minimum, serving as a loop‑break condition for iterative optimization passes.
business_intent: Enable transpilation pipelines to terminate early when further circuit optimizations no longer yield significant improvements, thereby reducing runtime and resource consumption in quantum circuit compilation.
